author: CandleSmartHome.com
description: Privacy friendly voice control. Control devices, set timers, reminders, alarms and more. Supports satellites, so it can be used in multiple rooms.
name: Voco

Authorization token.description: To be allowed to get information on all your devices, you have to create an 'authorization' code. It's basically a very long password. You can generate it yourself under Settings -> Developer -> Create local authorization. Any code you add here will override the code set throug the interface.

Metric.description: Check the box to use metric values instead of imperial units. For example: temperature in Celcius or Fahrenheit.

Microphone.description: What type of microphone are you using? With a USB microphone it's most likely 'Attached device (1,0)'.

Speaker.description: In some cases the Raspberry Pi might be set to a specific audio output. Here you can 'force' it to be a certain output. Default is 'auto', where it tries to auto-detect the last thing you plugged in (HDMI cable or audio jack).

Audio sample rate.description: In rare cases, if you are using a USB speaker you may need to set a specific samplerate before the speaker will play audio, or play it at the correct speed. If you use a Jabra USB speaker you probably have to set this to 48000.

Voice accent.description: Select an accent that you'd like the speaking voice to have. Default is en-GB

Voice pitch.description: Select how high or low you'd like to voice to sound. Default is 1.2.

Voice speed.description: How fast should the voice speak? Default is 0.9.

Hotword sensitivity.description: How sensitive should the system be to 'hey snips'? If it's often responding when nobody said the actual hotword, then you could try lowering this sensitivity. Default is 0.5.

System audio volume.description: When provided, the system volume will be set to this volume percentage level when Voco starts. This is separate from Voco's own volume, which is relative to the system volume. Can be between 0 and 100 percent.

Sound detection.description: When enabled, an extra switch will be created in the voice control thing. That switch will be turned on for 10 seconds whenever speech or sound is detected.

Hey Candle.description: When enabled, you can also say 'Hey Candle' to start a command.

Satellite device control.description: If this is a satellite, enabling this will allow you to control things on this satellite using your voice. It's recommended to give things on satellites unique names. For example, call 'radio' something like 'kitchen radio' instead. If a thing with the same name exists on the main controller and on a satellite, a voice command will always favour controlling the satellite's thing.

Debugging.description: Debugging allows you to diagnose any issues with the add-on. If enabled it will result in a lot more debug data in the internal log (which can be found under settings -> developer -> view internal logs).
